getMinFreeMemoryToTurnOff

public int getMinFreeMemoryToTurnOff()

Retrieves the minimum memory (percentage) that should be available to turn off congestion control.

Specified by:
getMinFreeMemoryToTurnOff in interface CongestionControlConfigurationMBean
Returns:

setMinFreeMemoryToTurnOff

public void setMinFreeMemoryToTurnOff(int minFreeMemoryToTurnOff)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from interface: CongestionControlConfigurationMBean
Sets the minimum memory (percentage) that should be available to turn off congestion control. This value should be set with respect to the value on getMinFreeMemoryToTurnOn(), a step higher so congestion control is not always turning on and off.

Specified by:
setMinFreeMemoryToTurnOff in interface CongestionControlConfigurationMBean
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

getPeriodBetweenChecks

public int getPeriodBetweenChecks()
Description copied from interface: CongestionControlConfigurationMBean
Retrieves the period in seconds to check if congestion control state should change. 0 means congestion control is off.

Specified by:
getPeriodBetweenChecks in interface CongestionControlConfigurationMBean
Returns:

setPeriodBetweenChecks

public void setPeriodBetweenChecks(int periodBetweenChecks)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from interface: CongestionControlConfigurationMBean
Sets the period in seconds to check if congestion control state should change. Use 0 to turn off congestion control.

Specified by:
setPeriodBetweenChecks in interface CongestionControlConfigurationMBean
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
